text: A banana is a yellow fruit that is soft and sweet.
A lemon is yellow and very sour.
A chili pepper is red and extremely spicy.
An apple can be red, green, or yellow and has a sweet taste.
Biryani is a flavorful Indian rice dish made with spices, rice, and usually meat or vegetables.
Samosa is a fried or baked pastry with a spicy potato filling, popular as a snack in India.
Paneer butter masala is a creamy tomato-based curry made with Indian cottage cheese.
Masala dosa is a thin, crispy fermented crepe filled with spicy mashed potatoes.
Chole is a spicy chickpea curry from North India, often eaten with rice or bhature.
Rasgulla is a spongy dessert made from ball-shaped dumplings of chhena cooked in light syrup.
Naan is a soft and fluffy flatbread that is traditionally baked in a tandoor.
Tandoori chicken is chicken marinated in yogurt and spices, roasted in a tandoor.
Gulab jamun is a deep-fried milk-solid ball soaked in sweet syrup, served as dessert.
Pav bhaji is a spicy vegetable mash served with soft buttered buns.
Raita is a yogurt-based condiment that cools down spicy dishes.
Dhokla is a soft and fluffy savory cake made from fermented rice and chickpea flour.
Butter chicken is a rich tomato gravy dish with tender pieces of marinated chicken.
Lassi is a cold yogurt drink blended with sugar, salt, or fruits like mango.
Momo is a type of South Asian dumpling popular in Nepal, filled with meat or vegetables and served with spicy chutney.
Sel roti is a traditional homemade, sweet, ring-shaped rice bread from Nepal.
Hilsa curry is a traditional Bengali dish made with hilsa fish and mustard gravy.
Bhuna khichuri is a spiced rice and lentil dish often served with beef curry in Bangladesh.
Nihari is a slow-cooked stew of beef or lamb, eaten as breakfast in Pakistan.
Chicken Karahi is a spicy curry cooked in a wok-like pan called a karahi, popular in Pakistan.
Pad Thai is a stir-fried noodle dish with shrimp, peanuts, and tamarind sauce, one of Thailand's national dishes.
Tom Yum is a hot and sour Thai soup made with shrimp, lemongrass, and lime juice.
Pho is a Vietnamese noodle soup consisting of broth, rice noodles, herbs, and meat.
Nasi Goreng is Indonesian-style fried rice often cooked with kecap manis, garlic, shallots, and chili.
Rendang is a spicy meat dish slow-cooked in coconut milk and spices, originating from Indonesia.
Nasi lemak is Malaysia's national dish consisting of fragrant rice cooked in coconut milk, served with sambal, anchovies, and egg.
Adobo is a Filipino dish made by marinating meat in vinegar, soy sauce, and garlic, then simmering it.
Halo-halo is a Filipino dessert made from crushed ice, evaporated milk, and mixed ingredients like sweet beans, fruits, and jellies.
Peking duck is a famous Beijing dish featuring crispy roasted duck served with pancakes, hoisin sauce, and scallions.
Kung Pao chicken is a spicy stir-fry dish made with chicken, peanuts, vegetables, and chili peppers.
Mapo tofu is a Sichuan dish featuring soft tofu in a spicy chili and bean-based sauce, typically with minced pork.
Xiao long bao are Chinese soup dumplings filled with meat and hot broth, typically served in a bamboo steamer.
Chow mein is a stir-fried noodle dish made with vegetables and sometimes meat or seafood.
Hot and sour soup is a Chinese soup made with mushrooms, tofu, bamboo shoots, and egg, flavored with vinegar and white pepper.
Dim sum refers to a variety of small Chinese dishes served with tea, including dumplings, buns, and rolls.
Mooncake is a traditional Chinese pastry filled with lotus seed paste or red bean, eaten during the Mid-Autumn Festival.
Kimchi is a traditional Korean side dish made from fermented vegetables, usually cabbage and radish, with chili pepper and garlic.
Bibimbap is a Korean mixed rice dish topped with sautéed vegetables, sliced meat, a fried egg, and chili paste.
Tteokbokki is a popular Korean street food made of chewy rice cakes in a spicy red sauce.
Beef noodle soup is a beloved Taiwanese dish made with braised beef, vegetables, and noodles in a flavorful broth.
Lu rou fan is a classic Taiwanese comfort food of minced pork belly cooked in soy sauce, served over rice.
Bubble tea is a Taiwanese drink made with tea, milk, and chewy tapioca pearls.
Char siu is a Cantonese-style barbecued pork known for its sweet and savory glaze.
Egg tarts are a popular Hong Kong dessert consisting of a flaky pastry crust filled with egg custard.
Wonton noodles are a Hong Kong dish made with thin egg noodles and wontons in a clear broth.
Meat pie is an iconic Australian dish consisting of a flaky pastry filled with minced meat and gravy.
Lamingtons are sponge cakes coated in chocolate and rolled in coconut, a popular Australian dessert.
Pavlova is a meringue-based dessert topped with fresh fruit and cream, considered a national dish of New Zealand.
Hangi is a traditional Māori method of cooking meat and vegetables in an underground oven.
Palusami is a Polynesian dish of taro leaves filled with coconut cream and sometimes meat, baked in banana leaves.
Oka is a Samoan raw fish salad marinated in citrus and coconut milk, similar to ceviche.
Lovo is a Fijian feast where food is wrapped in banana leaves and cooked in an earth oven.
Kokoda is a Fijian dish of raw fish marinated in lime juice and coconut milk, similar to ceviche.
Poke is a Hawaiian dish of diced raw fish, typically seasoned with soy sauce and sesame oil.
Spam musubi is a Hawaiian snack made of rice and Spam wrapped in seaweed.
Loco moco is a Hawaiian dish consisting of rice topped with a hamburger patty, fried egg, and brown gravy.
Sushi is a Japanese dish of vinegared rice combined with seafood, vegetables, and sometimes tropical fruits.
Ramen is a Japanese noodle soup dish with Chinese-style wheat noodles served in a meat or fish-based broth.
Tempura is a Japanese dish of seafood or vegetables that have been battered and deep-fried.
Miso soup is a traditional Japanese soup consisting of a stock called dashi into which softened miso paste is mixed.
Okonomiyaki is a savory Japanese pancake containing a variety of ingredients.
Hummus is a Middle Eastern dip or spread made from cooked, mashed chickpeas blended with tahini, olive oil, lemon juice, and garlic.
Falafel consists of deep-fried balls of ground chickpeas or fava beans, typically served in pita bread.
Shawarma is a Middle Eastern meat preparation where thin slices of lamb, chicken, or beef are stacked and roasted on a vertical rotisserie.
Tabbouleh is a Levantine vegetarian salad made of finely chopped parsley, tomatoes, mint, and bulgur.
Baklava is a rich, sweet dessert pastry made of layers of filo filled with chopped nuts and sweetened with syrup or honey.
Buuz are Mongolian steamed dumplings filled with minced meat, typically mutton or beef.
Khorkhog is a Mongolian barbecue dish where meat is cooked with hot stones inside a sealed container.
Airag is a traditional Mongolian alcoholic drink made from fermented mare's milk.
Boortsog are Mongolian deep-fried cookies often served with tea or used as a dessert.
Suutei tsai is a traditional Mongolian milk tea made with green tea, milk, water, and salt.
Kabsa is a fragrant rice dish with meat, vegetables, and spices.
Kibbeh is a fried or baked croquettes made from bulgur wheat, onions, and minced meat.
Mansaf is a traditional Jordanian dish made of lamb cooked in a sauce of fermented dried yogurt and served with rice.
Fattoush is a Levantine salad made with mixed greens, tomatoes, cucumbers, radishes, and toasted pita bread.
Kunafa is a Middle Eastern dessert made with thin noodle-like pastry soaked in sweet syrup and layered with cheese or nuts.
Shakshuka is a dish where eggs are poached in spiced tomato sauce with peppers, providing high-quality protein, lycopene for heart health, and vitamin C for immune support.
Gado-Gado is an Indonesian salad with blanched vegetables, tofu, and peanut sauce, offering plant-based protein, healthy fats, fiber, and diverse micronutrients from varied vegetables.
Baba Ganoush is a roasted eggplant dip with tahini, rich in antioxidants, fiber, calcium from sesame seeds, and heart-healthy monounsaturated fats.
Poke Bowl is raw fish with rice and vegetables, providing omega-3 fatty acids for brain health, lean protein, and antioxidants from fresh produce.
Dahl is spiced lentil stew loaded with plant-based protein, iron, folate, resistant starch for gut health, and anti-inflammatory spices like turmeric.
Paella is rice slowly simmered with saffron, seafood or meat, and vegetables in a wide shallow pan until the bottom forms a crispy crust.
Beef Bourguignon is beef chunks braised low and slow in red wine with mushrooms, onions, and herbs until fork-tender.
Moussaka is a layered eggplant, spiced meat, and béchamel sauce baked in the oven until golden and bubbling.
Cacio e Pepe is pasta tossed with reserved starchy pasta water, pecorino cheese, and black pepper to create a creamy emulsified sauce.
Tiramisu is ladyfinger cookies soaked in espresso, layered with whipped mascarpone cream, and chilled until set.

Som Tam (Green Papaya Salad) is a Thai dish made from shredded unripe papaya, tomatoes, green beans, lime juice, fish sauce, chilies, and peanuts. It is typically prepared by pounding the ingredients in a mortar to release flavors. Nutritionally, it is rich in fiber, vitamin C, and antioxidants, while being low in calories and fat. Regional variations include sweeter versions in Central Thailand and spicier ones in Isan. Dietary tags: Gluten-free, Dairy-free. Allergens: Peanuts, fish sauce.

Dal Tadka is an Indian dish made from yellow lentils cooked with turmeric, onions, tomatoes, and tempered with ghee, cumin, garlic, and chilies. It is simmered until creamy and served with rice or roti. Nutritionally, it is high in plant protein, fiber, folate, and iron. Dal is central to Indian diets, with variations across regions (e.g., spicier in Punjab, coconut-based in South India). Dietary tags: Vegetarian, Gluten-free. Allergens: None (unless ghee is avoided for vegan).

Nopalitos Salad is a Mexican dish made from diced cactus paddles, tomatoes, onions, cilantro, lime juice, and sometimes queso fresco. The cactus is boiled or grilled to remove bitterness. Nutritionally, it is rich in fiber, antioxidants, calcium, and vitamin C, while being low in calories. It is a traditional dish in central Mexico, often eaten during Lent. Dietary tags: Vegan (without cheese), Low-calorie. Allergens: Dairy (if cheese added).

Quinoa Salad with Roasted Vegetables is a South American-inspired dish featuring quinoa, roasted bell peppers, zucchini, carrots, olive oil, and lemon dressing. Quinoa is simmered until fluffy, then combined with roasted vegetables for a nutrient-dense meal. Nutritionally, it is high in complete plant protein, fiber, magnesium, and antioxidants. Quinoa originates from the Andes, where it has been cultivated for thousands of years. Regional variations include adding avocado or beans. Dietary tags: Vegan, Gluten-free. Allergens: None.

Grilled Salmon with Dill Yogurt Sauce is a Scandinavian dish featuring salmon fillets grilled until tender, served with a sauce of yogurt, dill, lemon, and garlic. Nutritionally, salmon provides omega-3 fatty acids, vitamin D, and high-quality protein, while yogurt adds probiotics and calcium. Scandinavian cuisine emphasizes fresh fish due to its coastal geography. Variations include serving with boiled potatoes or rye bread. Dietary tags: Pescatarian, High-protein. Allergens: Dairy, fish.

Mediterranean Lentil Soup is made with lentils, carrots, celery, onions, garlic, olive oil, and herbs like thyme and bay leaf. It is simmered until thick and hearty. Nutritionally, it is rich in plant protein, fiber, folate, and iron, while being low in fat. Lentil soups are common across Mediterranean and Middle Eastern cuisines, often eaten during winter months. Variations include adding spinach or lemon juice for brightness. Dietary tags: Vegan, Gluten-free. Allergens: None.

Gyro is a Greek comfort food made from seasoned lamb or chicken cooked on a vertical rotisserie, served in pita bread with tomatoes, onions, and tzatziki sauce. It is grilled for smoky flavor and wrapped for convenience. Gyros became popular in Greece in the 20th century, influenced by Ottoman doner kebabs, and are now a beloved street food across the Mediterranean. Dietary tags: Contains gluten, Dairy. Allergens: Dairy (tzatziki), gluten (pita).

Tamales are a Mexican comfort food made from masa (corn dough) filled with meats, cheese, or chilies, wrapped in corn husks, and steamed. They are labor-intensive, often prepared communally during holidays. Tamales date back to Aztec and Mayan civilizations as portable food for warriors. Regional variations include sweet tamales with raisins or savory ones with mole. Dietary tags: Gluten-free. Allergens: Dairy (if cheese used).

Poutine is a Canadian comfort food made from French fries topped with cheese curds and smothered in hot gravy. The fries are deep-fried until crisp, then layered with squeaky cheese curds and rich beef or chicken gravy. Originating in Quebec in the 1950s, it quickly became a national symbol of indulgence. Variations include adding pulled pork, mushrooms, or even foie gras. Dietary tags: Contains gluten, Dairy. Allergens: Dairy, gluten.

Shepherd’s Pie is a British comfort dish made from minced lamb or beef cooked with onions, carrots, peas, and gravy, topped with mashed potatoes and baked until golden. It is hearty and warming, often associated with rural traditions. Shepherd’s Pie dates back to the 18th century as a way to use leftover meat and potatoes. Variations include Cottage Pie (with beef) and vegetarian versions with lentils. Dietary tags: Non-vegetarian. Allergens: Dairy (butter, milk), gluten (gravy).

Pierogi are Polish dumplings made from dough filled with potatoes, cheese, sauerkraut, or meat, boiled and sometimes pan-fried with butter and onions. They are a beloved comfort food tied to family gatherings and holidays. Pierogi originated in Central and Eastern Europe, with Polish versions becoming iconic. Variations include sweet pierogi with fruit fillings. Dietary tags: Contains gluten, Dairy. Allergens: Gluten, dairy.

Macaroni and Cheese is a classic American comfort food made from elbow macaroni pasta baked or stovetop-cooked with a creamy cheese sauce, often using cheddar, milk, and butter. The dish is baked until golden or served directly from the pot for a gooey texture. It became popular in the United States in the 19th century, influenced by European pasta-and-cheese recipes, and was famously served by Thomas Jefferson after his travels to France. Regional variations include baked versions with breadcrumbs in the South and stovetop versions in the North. Dietary tags: Contains gluten, Dairy. Allergens: Gluten, dairy.
